Data.event_text: - In a landmark 43 judgement, the Supreme Court of India held that an appeal for votes during elections on the basis of religion, caste, race, community or language, even that of the electorate, will amount to a ‘corrupt practice’ and call for disqualification of the candidate in any election

links.text: -Rajagopal, Krishnadas (2017-01-02). "Seeking votes on religious basis a corrupt act: SC". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 2017-12-26.-
-Rajagopal, Krishnadas (2017-01-02). "Seeking votes on religious basis a corrupt act: SC". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 2017-12-26.-

Data.event_text: - Nuclear-capable intercontinental ballistic missile Agni-IV Missile tested successfully off the coast of Odisha.

links.text: -"Nuclear-capable Agni-IV missile successfully test-fired off Odisha coast". 2 January 2017.-

Data.event_text: Heavy snowfall in Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand disrupt normal life. Many places record heaviest snowfall in over two decades.

links.text: -"शिमला में 48 घंटे में 3 फीट बर्फबारी, 26 साल का रिकॉर्ड टूटा, कश्मीर-हिमाचल में कई जगहों पर हिमस्खलन की वार्निंग". 8 January 2017.-

Data.event_text: 25 people are dead after a boat capsizes on river Ganga in Patna during Makar Sankranti celebrations.

links.text: -"24 Dead After Boat Carrying 40 Capsizes In River Ganga In Bihar's Patna, Many Still Missing". NDTV.com.-

Data.event_text: - United Arab Emirates delegation led by Shaikh Mohammad Bin Zayed Al Nahyan, crown prince of Abu Dhabi visited India to sign 14 agreements including strategic partnership, defense industries, transport, cyber security and shipping.

links.text: -Staff Report (2017-01-24). "UAE, India to sign over a dozen pacts as top leaders meet". GulfNews. Retrieved 2017-01-28.-

Data.event_text: - Avalanches hit Jammu and Kashmir. 20 persons including 15 military personnel are found dead.

links.text: -"Over 20 dead, including 15 army personnel, in avalanches since Wednesday". The Economic Times. Retrieved 2017-01-28.-

Data.event_text: Republic Day is celebrated across the country. Mohammed bin Zayed Al Nahyan attends the parade in New Delhi as the chief guest.

links.text: -"Why UAE Crown Prince is a very special Republic Day guest". The Indian Express. 2017-01-26. Retrieved 2017-12-26.-

Data.event_text: The annual budget for the union government is presented in the Lok Sabha by finance minister Arun Jaitley. The 92-year-old railway budget is discontinued and merged into the general budget.

links.text: -"Union Budget 2017–18 to be presented on February 1: Government sources". 16 July 2017 – via The Economic Times.-
-"Railway budget to be merged with General budget from 2017". The Hindu. 2016-08-14.-

Data.event_text: One person is dead after a 5.8 magnitude earthquake hit Uttrakhand, North India.

links.text: -"Earthquake of 5.8 magnitude hits Uttarakhand, northern India; no reports of damage". Firstpost. 2017-02-07. Retrieved 2017-02-07.-

Data.event_text: Indian Space Research Organisation launches PSLV-C37, sending104 satellites from seven countries into orbit, the highest ever in the history of space exploration.

links.text: -"ISRO satellite launch: Proud moment for India, 104 satellites placed in orbit". The Indian Express. 2017-02-15. Retrieved 2017-02-15.-

Data.event_text: 6 March  Indian Navy's oldest serving aircraft carrier, INS Viraat is decommissioned after 30 years of service.

links.text: -"Oldest serving aircraft carrier INS Viraat to be decommissioned today – Times of India". The Times of India. Retrieved 2017-03-07.-

Data.event_text: 7 March  Nine people are injured after a planned low intensity explosion in Bhopal-Ujjain passenger train by ISIS. Uttar Pradesh Anti-Terrorism Squad neutralises one terrorist in Lucknow, 8 suspects arrested from Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh.

links.text: -"Lucknow encounter: 6 from UP held after train blast, 2 holed up". The Indian Express. 2017-03-08. Retrieved 2017-03-08.-

Data.event_text: 11 March   Election results of elections in five states declared by Election Commission.
11 March  12 CRPF personnel killed in Naxal attack in Chhattisgarh.

links.text: -"Chhattisgarh: 12 CRPF personnel killed in Naxal attack". 11 March 2017.-

Data.event_text: 14 March  Manohar Parrikar took oath as the new Chief Minister of Goa.

links.text: -"Manohar Parrikar Takes Charge Of Goa, Trust Vote Thursday, Says Top Court: 10 Facts". NDTV.com. Retrieved 2017-03-15.-

Data.event_text: 15 March  N. Biren Singh took oath as the new Chief Minister of Manipur.

links.text: -"मणिपुर में पहली बार BJP सरकार, एन बीरेन सिंह ने ली CM पद की शपथ". aajtak.intoday.in (in Hindi). Retrieved 2017-03-15.-

Data.event_text: 16 March  Amarinder Singh took oath as the new Chief Minister of Punjab.

links.text: -"Amarinder Singh sworn in as Punjab CM". The Hindu. Retrieved 2017-03-16.-

Data.event_text: 18 March  Yogi Adityanath took oath as the new Chief Minister of Uttar Pradesh.
26 March  Lucknow Metro Northsouth line is expected to be opened.

1 April  the Gujarat Assembly amended a bill further extending the punishment and fine for Cattle slaughter in India. The punishment was increased to a minimum of 10 years and a maximum of 'life term of a 14 years', and the fine was enhanced to the range of ₹1 lakh  ₹5 lakh.

links.text: -"Gujarat to punish cow slaughter with 14-year jail – Times of India". The Times of India. Retrieved 2 April 2017.-
-"Gujarat: India state approves life term for killing cows". BBC News. 31 March 2017. Retrieved 2 April 2017.-
-Langa, Mahesh. "Gujarat to tighten cow slaughter law". The Hindu. Retrieved 2 April 2017.-
-"Life term for killing cows, Chief Minister Vijay Rupani says want 'vegetarian' Gujarat". The Indian Express. 1 April 2017. Retrieved 2 April 2017.-

Data.event_text: 9 April - Kashmir human shield incident
6 June - Uttar Pradesh's Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath directed the state police to take action against cow slaughter and cattle smuggling under the National Security Act and the Gangster Act.

links.text: -"Cattle smuggling, slaughter in UP now punishable under National Security Act". Hindustan Times. 6 June 2017. Retrieved 8 June 2017.-

Data.event_text: 9 June  India became full member of Shanghai Cooperation Organisation.

links.text: -Korablinov, Alexander (20 January 2017). "India, Pakistan to become full SCO members in June 2017 – Lavrov".-

Data.event_text: 16 June  Gorkhaland agitations in Darjeeling, West Bengal.
17 June  Kochi Metro inaugurated.
19 June  BJP announced Ramanath Kovind as its candidate for the presidential election
20 June  Presidential election.
23 June  ISRO puts 31 satellites including 29 satellites from others countries through PSLV C-38 successfully.

links.text: -Rohit, T.K. "ISRO puts 31 satellites in space". The Hindu. Retrieved 2017-06-26.-

Data.event_text: 1 July  Goods and Services Tax (India) Act came into force in India. The India's biggest tax reform in 70 years of independence, was launched at midnight of 30 . It replaced many Indirect taxes.

1 July  Goods and Services Tax (India) Act came into force in India. The India's biggest tax reform in 70 years of independence, was launched at midnight of 30 June 2017. It replaced many Indirect taxes.
10 July  7 pilgrims killed, 16 injured during Amarnath Yatra in terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag.

links.text: -"7 Amarnath Yatra Pilgrims Killed In Terror Attack In Jammu And Kashmir's Anantnag". NDTV.com.-

Data.event_text: 11 July  Major landslide occurred in Arunachal Pradesh. 14 people died while many injured
12 July  3 terrorist shot dead in Badgam
15 July  3 terrorist of Jaish e Mohammad shot dead in Tral of Jammu & Kashmir by Indian military.

links.text: -"Tral encounter: Three JeM terrorists killed, security forces face stone-pelting during ops". 2017-07-15.-

Data.event_text: 16 July  16 Amarnath devotees killed in a bus accident in Jammu and Kashmir.
17 July  Indian presidential elections were held.
July  Heavy rain due to Monsoon raised level of most of the rivers causing flood in many states. More than 200 died.

links.text: -"Flood in India in 2017". 2017-07-17.-

Data.event_text: 17 July  BJP led NDA declared Venkai Naidu as their candidate for vice-presidential election.
18 July  Congress protests against Madhur Bhandarkar's film Indu Sarkar based on 1975 emergency in India.
20 July  Ram Nath Kovind won the 2017 Indian presidential election  with 65.65% votes against Meira Kumar, the presidential candidate of the opposition.

links.text: -"Ram Nath Kovind will be the 14 President of India". Archived from the original on 2017-07-21.-
-"Ram Nath Kovind will be the 14 President of India". Archived from the original on 2017-07-21.-

Data.event_text: 25 July  Ram Nath Kovind took oath as 14th President of India.
26 July  Nitish Kumar (JDU) resigns as Chief Minister of Bihar, breaking the coalition with RJD & Indian National Congress.
27 July  NDA (JDU + BJP) led government comes in Bihar. Nitish Kumar and Sushil Modi took oath as chief minister and vice chief minister of Bihar respectively.
July  2017 Gujarat flood resulting in more than 250 deaths.
July  2017 West Bengal floods; 70 died.
1 August  Lashkar-E-Taiba militant Abu Dujana Shot dead by Indian Army In Jammu and Kashmir
4 August  Indian National Congress Vice-President Rahul Gandhi's car attacked by mob in Banaskatha in Gujarat
Venkaiah Naidu was elected as the Vice President of India.5 August  Venkaiah Naidu won the Indian vice-presidential election with 67.89% votes against Gopalkrishna Gandhi the opposition candidate.

links.text: -"Venkaiah Naidu elected as 13th vice president of India". Indian Express. 5 August 2017. Retrieved 5 August 2017.-

Data.event_text: 6 August  Bangladeshi terrorist arrested by Uttar Pradesh Police in Muzaffarnagar
7 August  Kerala High Court removed lifetime ban on cricketer S. Sreesanth
9 August  Maratha Kranti Morcha starts in Mumbai for the demand for reservation for the Maratha community in the state of Maharashtra
11 August  Venkaiah Naidu took oath as 13th Vice President of India.
13 August  46 died in a landslide in Mandi district of Himachal Pradesh.

links.text: -Yogendra, Kanwar (August 13, 2017). "46 die as cloudburst triggers landslip in Himachal Pradesh". The Hindu.-

Data.event_text: 15 August  Nation celebrated 70th Independence Day.
August   Nepal and India floods; more than 450 died.

links.text: -"Death toll in Nepal floods climbs to 91 - Times of India". The Times of India.-

Data.event_text: 19 August  Kalinga Utkal Express from Puri to Haridwar derailed in Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh. 23 died, more than 100 injured.

links.text: -"At Least 23 Killed, Over 70 Injured As Utkal Express Derails In UP's Muzaffarnagar". NDTV.com.-

Data.event_text: 22 August  Supreme Court bans instant triple talaq calling it unconstitutional. Instructed central government to pass law in parliament for triple talaq.

links.text: -"Triple talaq: India court bans Islamic instant divorce". BBC News. August 22, 2017.-

Data.event_text: 24 August - Reserve Bank of India introduces Rs. 200 bank notes in India to plug the gap in currency system by abiding to Renard series.

links.text: -"₹200 banknotes in circulation from today". www.thehindubusinessline.com. 24 August 2017. Retrieved 2022-04-15.-
-"RBI all set to release Rs 200 currency note today".-

Data.event_text: 25 August  Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh conviction in rape case leads to violence by Dera Sacha Sauda's followers in Punjab, Haryana. 38 died, 300 injured. Army out, curfew clamped in Punjab, Panchkula, Chandigarh.

links.text: -"Highlights | Ram Rahim conviction leads to violence; 30 killed; dera chief jailed in Rohtak". Hindustan Times. August 25, 2017.-

Data.event_text: 28 August  CBI special court sentenced Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh 20 years jail in a verdict of a rape case.

links.text: -"Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh sentence hearing as it happened: Dera chief languishes alone in Rohtak jail". Firstpost. August 28, 2017.-

Data.event_text: 28 August  Dipak Misra sworn in as 45th chief justice of India.

links.text: -"Justice Dipak Misra takes oath as 45th CJI". The Hindu. August 28, 2017.-

Data.event_text: 28 August  India China agree to end border stand off in Doklam as both nations withdrew their armies from the disputed region.

links.text: -"India China agree to end border standoff". Reuters. 2017-08-29.-

Data.event_text: 28 August  Election commission declared by election result of four legislative seats of three states. AAP won Delhi's Bawana, BJP won Goa's Panji and Valpoi, TDP won Nandyal in Andhra Pradesh.

links.text: -"by election result".-

Data.event_text: 29 August  NagpurMumbai Duronto Express derailed near Asangoan in the outskirts of Mumbai; No casualties reported.
29 August  Flood in the city of Mumbai. Lifeline came to still. The railway malfunctioned due to heavy rains.  Mumbai-Pune Express highway closed.
30 August  290 children have died at BRD Medical College in Gorakhpur due to lack of oxygen.

links.text: -"This August, 290 children died at Gorakhpur's BRD Medical College, says official". August 30, 2017.-

Data.event_text: 31 August - A three-story building collapsed in Mumbai, 32 died.

links.text: -"Mumbai Building Collapses Killing 32, Was Declared Unsafe 6 Years Ago". NDTV.com.-

Data.event_text: 31 August - Switzerland president Doris Leuthard visited India for a bilateral talk.

links.text: -"Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Swiss President Hold Talks On Bilateral, Regional, Global Issues". NDTV.com.-

Data.event_text: 31 August - ISRO launch of navigation satellite IRNSS 1H failed after heat shield does not detach.

links.text: -"ISRO launch fails after heat shield does not detach". IndianExpress.com. 1 September 2017. Retrieved 20 October 2017.-

Data.event_text: 1 September  Union Skill Development Minister Rajiv Pratap Rudy and Minister of State for Human Resource Development Mahendra Nath Pandey resigned ahead of a cabinet reshuffle.
1 September - Suicide of S. Anitha.
Cabinet expansion conducted in Rashtrapati Bhavan, 9 new ministers took the oath. Nirmala Sitaraman and Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi got promoted to Cabinet Ministers.
Nirmala Sitharaman became defense minister of India.
Narendra Modi on visit of China for 9th BRICS Summit and Myanmar for bilateral talk.

links.text: -"PM Narendra Modi reaches Myanmar: Five reasons why his visit is important". HindustanTimes.com. 5 September 2017. Retrieved 20 October 2017.-

Data.event_text: Lucknow Metro inaugurated.

links.text: -"Lucknow Metro develops technical snag on Day 1, passengers evacuated". Intoday.in. Retrieved 20 October 2017.-

Data.event_text: Gauri Lankesh, senior journalist shot dead in Bangalore.

links.text: -"Gauri Lankesh murder: Journalist who spoke her mind shot dead in Bengaluru". IndianExpress.com. 6 September 2017. Retrieved 20 October 2017.-

Data.event_text: 7 September  A goods train derailed near Khandala in Maharashtra.
1112 September  Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko visited India for bilateral talk, signed 10 agreement including defense.

links.text: -"India, Belarus sign 10 pacts to expand bilateral cooperation in defence, economy and education". Firstpost. September 12, 2017.-

Data.event_text: 1314 September  Japan prime minister Shinzo Abe visited Ahmadabad for bilateral talk, signed many agreement including Bullet Train project in India.

links.text: -"A Hug, Roadshow With PM Modi As Japan's Abe Starts Gujarat Tour: 10 Facts". NDTV.com.-

Data.event_text: 29 September  22 killed, many injured when a stampede occurred on the Lower Parel and Prabhadevi stations in Mumbai
10 October  BJP emerged as largest party in the Gram Panchayat Elections in Maharashtra for the first time followed by Congress.
11 October  Australia cricket team bus attacked by mob in Guwahati after the T20I match played between India and Australia. Two Arrested.
16 October  6 Corporaters in Mumbai joined Shivsena leaving Raj's MNS.
4 November  Mohammed Siraj made his T20I Debut against New Zealand at Rajkot
9 November  Legislative election will take place in Himachal Pradesh
18 November  Manushi Chhillar won the 6th Miss World crown for India in Sanya, China.
29 November  Inauguration of Hyderabad Metro.

links.text: -Garari, Kaniza (November 30, 2017). "Hyd Metro gets rousing welcome, 1 lakh people travel on the first day". Deccan Chronicle.-

Data.event_text: 1 December  Uttar Pradesh municipal corporation result declared by state election commission.
2 December  Cyclone Ockhi hits Tamil Nadu and Kerala causing many deaths.

links.text: -"NDTV As Cyclone Ockhi wanes Kanyakumari remains in knee deep water". Archived from the original on 2017-12-02. Retrieved 2017-12-02.-
-"NDTV As Cyclone Ockhi wanes Kanyakumari remains in knee deep water". Archived from the original on 2017-12-02. Retrieved 2017-12-02.-

Data.event_text: 3 December - A group of Hindutva activists desecerate Baba Budangiri durgah in Karnataka and instigate communal violence.

links.text: -"Karnataka: Mob enters protected area during Datta Jayanthi, tension at Baba Budangiri Hills". The New Indian Express. 2017-12-04. Retrieved 2024-12-16.-

Data.event_text: 914 December  polling for Gujarat legislative assembly election take place.
7 December  Earthquake shakes Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, and the North India on a Richter Scale of 5.5.

links.text: -"GK Question". Gyan Box. Archived from the original on 2018-05-11. Retrieved 11 May 2018.-
-"GK Question". Gyan Box. Archived from the original on 2018-05-11. Retrieved 11 May 2018.-

Data.event_text: 7 December  Mani Shankar Aiyar removed from Congress.
10 December  Shreyas Iyer made his ODI debut against Sri Lanka at Dharamsala.
11 December  5 soldiers missing as avalanche hits Gurez sector in Jammu & Kashmir.

links.text: -"5 Soldiers Missing After Avalanche In Jammu And Kashmir's Bandipora, Nowgam". NDTV.com.-

Data.event_text: 13 December  Rohit Sharma scored third double century in ODIs against Sri Lanka.

links.text: -"Rohit Scored 3rd double century". The Hindu. 13 December 2017.-

Data.event_text: 13 December  Washington Sundar made his ODI debut against Sri Lanka at Mohali
16 December  Rahul Gandhi takes over as Congress president

links.text: -Phukan, Sandeep (2017-12-16). "Rahul Gandhi takes over as Congress president". The Hindu.-

Data.event_text: 18 December  The Bharatiya Janata Party wins majority of the seats in the recently concluded Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh assembly elections.
